Package entity

Interface ClaimContactRoleOwner

All Superinterfaces:
Bean, com.guidewire.pl.persistence.core.BeanMethods, BundleProvider, ClaimContactRoleOwner, Comparable<Bean>, Editable, com.guidewire.cc.domain.contact.EntityContactRoleOwner, com.guidewire.commons.entity.Keyable, KeyableBean, com.guidewire.commons.entity.Sourceable, Versionable
All Known Implementing Classes:
APDIncident, BaggageIncident, Claim, DwellingIncident, Evaluation, Exposure, FixedPropertyIncident, Incident, InjuryIncident, LivingExpensesIncident, Matter, MobilePropertyIncident, Negotiation, OtherStructureIncident, Policy, PropertyContentsIncident, PropertyIncident, TripIncident, VehicleIncident
@Generated(value="com.guidewire.pl.metadata.codegen.Codegen", comments="ClaimContactRoleOwner.eti;ClaimContactRoleOwner.eix;ClaimContactRoleOwner.etx") public interface ClaimContactRoleOwner extends Editable, ClaimContactRoleOwner
ClaimContactRoleOwner Interface for entities that can "own" ClaimContactRoles. Marking an entity as a ClaimContactRoleOwner means that it can be associated with ContactRoles. In practical terms, this means the entity will get ContactRole-based accessors that can then be used as items in NVVs. This gives a customers a way to add arbitrary Contacts to an entity, and have those roles appear in Parties Involved.

    • checkAddRole

      IRoleValidationFailure checkAddRole(ContactRole role, Contact contact)
      Determines whether or not the given role can be added to this ClaimContactRoleOwner. If not, returns a failure object describing the problem.

    • checkRemoveRole

      IRoleValidationFailure checkRemoveRole(ContactRole role, int count)
      Determines whether or not the given role can be removed the given number of times.
      Parameters:
      count - number of instances of the role to be removed

    • checkRoleAdded

      IRoleValidationFailure checkRoleAdded(ContactRole role, Contact contact)
      Checks the addition of the given role to the given contact, after it has occurred. To check the validity of adding a role before it has occurred, use checkAddRole(typekey.ContactRole, entity.Contact) instead.

    • checkRoleRemoved

      IRoleValidationFailure checkRoleRemoved(ContactRole role)
      Checks the removal of the given role, after it has occurred. To check the validity of removing a role before it has occurred, use checkRemoveRole(typekey.ContactRole, int) instead.

    • getClaimContactByRole

      ClaimContact getClaimContactByRole(ContactRole role) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Get the directly related ClaimContact with the given exclusive role.
      Parameters:
      role - An exclusive role
      Returns:
      ClaimContact or null if none exists
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the role is not exclusive

    • getClaimContactRoleByRole

      Gets the ClaimContactRole in the given exclusive role.
      Parameters:
      role - An exclusive role
      Returns:
      ClaimContactRole or null if none exists.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the role is not exclusive

    • getClaimContactsByRoles

      ClaimContact[] getClaimContactsByRoles(ContactRole[] roles)
      Gets the directly related ClaimContacts with at least one of the given roles.

    • getClaimContactsForAllRoles

      ClaimContact[] getClaimContactsForAllRoles()
      Gets the directly related ClaimContacts for all roles - all claim contacts owned by this object.
      If you need all contacts, including those that are indirectly related to the Claim, use Claim.getContacts()

    • getContactByRole

      Contact getContactByRole(ContactRole role) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Gets the contact serving in an exclusive role on this entity. This method should only be used with Exclusive roles. As an alternative to calling this method, you can read the value of the property with the name of the role.
      Returns:
      Contact or null if none exists
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the role is not exclusive

    • getContactsByRole

      Contact[] getContactsByRole(ContactRole role)
      Gets the directly related Contact in the given role on this entity. This method returns only contacts attached directly to the entity. Contacts attached to the entity's sub-objects are not returned.

    • getContactsByRoles

      Contact[] getContactsByRoles(ContactRole[] role)
      Gets the directly related Contacts with at least one of the given roles. Note that Contacts related to sub-objects will not be returned.

    • getContactsExcludeRole

      Contact[] getContactsExcludeRole(ContactRole role)

    • getContactsExcludeRoles

      Contact[] getContactsExcludeRoles(ContactRole[] roles)

    • getNonExclusiveRoles

      ClaimContactRole[] getNonExclusiveRoles()
      Return all the non-exclusive claim contact roles for this owner
      Returns:
      a list of claim contact role objects, possibly empty but never null

    • getSuitableNonExclusiveRolesFor

      ContactRole[] getSuitableNonExclusiveRolesFor(Contact contact)
      Return all non-exclusive contact roles which are suitable for this owner's type and the given contact. Used in the UI to restrict the user to suitable choices when adding a new contact/role pair to the role owner
      Parameters:
      contact - a contact, possibly null
      Returns:
      an array of suitable roles, or an empty array if there are none

    • isContactInRoleChanged

      boolean isContactInRoleChanged(ContactRole role)
      Determines whether some data on the contact in the given role has changed.

    • isContactInRoleDifferent

      boolean isContactInRoleDifferent(ContactRole role)
      Determines whether the contact in the given role is a different contact than the one originally in the role.

    • isExclusiveRole

      boolean isExclusiveRole(ContactRole role)
      Determines whether or not the given role has the 'Exclusive' constraint on this object.
      Parameters:
      role - a contact role, cannot be null

    • isRoleConstrained

      boolean isRoleConstrained(ContactRole role, com.guidewire.cc.domain.contact.config.RoleConstraintType constraintType)
      Determines whether or not the given role has the given constraint on this object.

    • removeAllRoles

      void removeAllRoles()
      Removes all roles associated with this ClaimContactRoleOwner.

    • removeRole

      void removeRole(ContactRole role, Contact contact)
      Removes the given role from the given Contact. Does nothing if the Contact does not have the role. This method should only be used with Required or ZeroToMore roles.
      Parameters:
      role - Role that is not exclusive
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the role is exclusive or prohibited, or the Contact is null or not of the right type for the given role. For exclusive roles, use EntityContactRoleOwner.setContactByRole(ContactRole, Contact) instead.

    • validateRoles

      IRoleValidationFailure[] validateRoles()
      Validates the ClaimContactRole assignments for this ClaimContactRoleOwner. Checks all applicable RoleConstraints.
